summary: The OpenAI package provides comprehensive integration with OpenAI's AI services including GPT-5, GPT-4o, o3, DALL-E 3, GPT-Image-1, Whisper, and more. This package enables you to build powerful automation workflows using state-of-the-art AI capabilities.
description: ## Features - **Text Generation**: Generate text using GPT-5, GPT-4o, o3, o1, and other language models with support for vision, tool calling, and streaming

connect.name: Connect
connect.summary: Establishes a connection to the OpenAI API service for accessing AI models and capabilities.
connect.howItWorks: The Connect node establishes a connection to OpenAI's API service. When executed: 1. Validates the API key from your Vault (if not using Robomotion Credits) 2. Creates a connection session to the OpenAI service 3. Returns a connection identifier that can be reused across multiple OpenAI nodes
usage: **With API Key**: A valid OpenAI API key stored in your Robomotion Vault
**With Robomotion Credits**: An active Robomotion account with available AI credits
Network access to OpenAI API endpoints

create-image-variation.name: CreateImageVariation
create-image-variation.summary: Create variations of an existing image using DALL-E 2.
create-image-variation.howItWorks: Creates variations of your image while maintaining its essential elements: 1. Validates Robomotion Credits connection 2. Loads the source PNG image 3. Generates variations based on the image 4. Saves generated images to temporary storage 5. Returns file paths
tips: Only PNG format supported (max 4MB)
Requires Robomotion Credits mode
Useful for generating logo variations, design alternatives, or creative iterations
Higher resolutions take longer and cost more

delete-file.name: DeleteFile
delete-file.summary: Delete a file from OpenAI file storage to free up space and remove unused files.
delete-file.howItWorks: Permanently deletes a file from OpenAI storage: 1. Validates connection and file ID 2. Sends delete request to OpenAI 3. Confirms deletion 4. Returns deletion status
tips: Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone
Files in use by assistants or fine-tuning jobs may not be immediately deletable
Use List Files to identify files to delete

disconnect.name: Disconnect
disconnect.summary: Closes an established connection to the OpenAI API service and releases associated resources.
disconnect.howItWorks: The Disconnect node properly closes an OpenAI connection. When executed: 1. Validates that a connection ID was provided 2. Locates the active connection 3. Closes the connection and releases resources 4. Removes the connection from the active connection pool
usage: A valid connection ID from a Connect node
The connection must still be active (not already disconnected)

download-file.name: DownloadFile
download-file.summary: Download a file from OpenAI file storage to your local filesystem.
download-file.howItWorks: Downloads a file from OpenAI to local storage: 1. Validates connection and file ID 2. Retrieves file metadata 3. Downloads file content 4. Saves to temporary directory 5. Returns local file path
tips: Files are saved to temp directory - move to permanent location if needed
Use with Retrieve File Metadata to check size before downloading
Original filename is preserved when possible

edit-image.name: EditImage
edit-image.summary: Edit an existing image based on a text prompt using DALL-E and GPT-Image models.
edit-image.howItWorks: The Edit Image node modifies existing images using AI. When executed: 1. Validates the connection with Robomotion Credits enabled 2. Loads the source image from the specified path 3. Loads the optional mask image (if provided) 4. Sends the image, mask, and edit prompt to OpenAI 5. Downloads and saves the edited image(s) 6. Returns the file path(s) to the edited image(s)
usage: **Robomotion AI Credits enabled** (direct API key not supported)
Connection Id from Connect node with Robomotion Credits enabled
Source image in PNG format (max 4MB)
Optional mask image in PNG format
Non-empty edit prompt
Write access to temporary file storage

generate-batch-embeddings.name: GenerateBatchEmbeddings
generate-batch-embeddings.summary: Generate vector embeddings for multiple texts in a single batch request for improved efficiency.
generate-batch-embeddings.howItWorks: Processes multiple texts in a single API call: 1. Validates connection and input array 2. Sends all texts to embedding model 3. Receives embeddings for all texts 4. Returns array of embeddings
usage: Connection Id from Connect node
Non-empty array of texts

generate-embedding.name: GenerateEmbedding
generate-embedding.summary: Generate vector embeddings from text using OpenAI embedding models for semantic search and similarity matching.
generate-embedding.howItWorks: Converts text into a numerical vector representation: 1. Validates connection and input text 2. Sends text to embedding model 3. Receives vector representation 4. Returns embedding array
usage: Connection Id from Connect node
Non-empty text input

generate-image.name: GenerateImage
generate-image.summary: Generates images from text descriptions using OpenAI's DALL-E and GPT-Image models.
generate-image.howItWorks: The Generate Image node creates images based on text descriptions. When executed: 1. Validates the connection or API key 2. Processes your text prompt 3. Configures size, quality, and style parameters 4. Sends the request to the selected image model 5. Downloads and saves the generated image(s) to temporary storage 6. Returns the file path(s) to the generated image(s)
usage: Either a Connection Id from Connect node OR an API Key credential
Non-empty prompt describing the desired image
Sufficient API credits or balance
Write access to temporary file storage

generate-speech.name: GenerateSpeech
generate-speech.summary: Convert text to natural-sounding speech using OpenAI's TTS models with multiple voice options.
generate-speech.howItWorks: Converts text to speech using advanced TTS models: 1. Validates connection and input text 2. Configures voice, format, and speed 3. Sends text to the TTS model 4. Downloads generated audio 5. Saves to temporary storage 6. Returns file path
usage: Connection Id from Connect node
Text between 1 and 4096 characters
Write access to temporary storage

generate-text.name: GenerateText
generate-text.summary: Generates text completions using OpenAI's language models with support for vision, chat history, tool calling, and streaming responses.
generate-text.howItWorks: The Generate Text node sends your prompt to OpenAI's language models. When executed: 1. Validates the connection or API key 2. Builds the conversation with system prompt, user prompt, and optional chat history 3. Processes any images (encodes local files to base64 or uses URLs directly) 4. Configures all generation parameters 5. Sends the request to the selected model 6. Returns the generated text response
usage: Either a Connection Id from Connect node OR an API Key credential
Non-empty User Prompt
For vision: GPT-4o or GPT-4o-mini model
For JSON mode: Compatible model (GPT-4o, GPT-4-turbo, etc.)
For tool calling: Model with function calling support
Local images must be in JPEG, PNG, WebP, or GIF format (max 20MB)

list-files.name: ListFiles
list-files.summary: List all files uploaded to your OpenAI file storage with optional filtering by purpose.
list-files.howItWorks: Retrieves the list of files from your OpenAI account: 1. Validates connection uses own API key 2. Optionally filters by purpose 3. Retrieves file list from OpenAI 4. Returns array of file objects
tips: Use Purpose Filter to focus on specific file types
Store file IDs from the list for later operations
Regularly clean up unused files to manage storage

list-models.name: ListModels
list-models.summary: List all available OpenAI models with their details and capabilities.
list-models.howItWorks: Retrieves the list of available models: 1. Validates connection 2. Requests model list from OpenAI 3. Returns array of model objects
tips: Models list includes text, embedding, image, and audio models
Model availability depends on your API access level
Use with Retrieve Model for detailed model information

moderate.name: Moderate
moderate.summary: Check text content for policy violations using OpenAI's moderation models to detect harmful or inappropriate content.
moderate.howItWorks: Analyzes content for policy violations: 1. Validates connection and input text 2. Sends text to moderation model 3. Checks against policy categories 4. Returns flagged status and categories
usage: Connection Id from Connect node
Non-empty text to check

retrieve-file-metadata.name: RetrieveFileMetadata
retrieve-file-metadata.summary: Retrieve metadata about a specific file in OpenAI file storage without downloading the file content.
retrieve-file-metadata.howItWorks: Retrieves metadata for a specific file: 1. Validates connection and file ID 2. Requests file metadata from OpenAI 3. Returns file information object
tips: Use this instead of Download File when you only need metadata
Faster than downloading the full file

retrieve-model.name: RetrieveModel
retrieve-model.summary: Retrieve detailed information about a specific OpenAI model including its capabilities and specifications.
retrieve-model.howItWorks: Retrieves information about a specific model: 1. Validates connection and model ID 2. Requests model details from OpenAI 3. Returns model information object
tips: Use List Models first to discover available model IDs
Model info includes creation date and ownership

similarity.name: Similarity
similarity.summary: Calculate cosine similarity between embeddings to find the most relevant content based on semantic meaning.
similarity.howItWorks: Finds the most similar content using cosine similarity: 1. Reads search query embedding from first CSV 2. Reads all content embeddings from second CSV 3. Calculates cosine similarity between query and each content 4. Sorts by similarity (highest first) 5. Returns top N matches

transcribe-audio.name: TranscribeAudio
transcribe-audio.summary: Transcribe audio files to text using OpenAI Whisper and GPT-4o transcription models.
transcribe-audio.howItWorks: Transcribes speech in audio files to text: 1. Validates connection and audio file path 2. Checks file format is supported 3. Uploads audio to OpenAI 4. Processes with selected model 5. Returns transcribed text
usage: Connection Id from Connect node
Valid audio file in supported format
File must exist and be accessible

translate-audio.name: TranslateAudio
translate-audio.summary: Translate audio from any language to English text using OpenAI Whisper model.
translate-audio.howItWorks: Translates speech from any language to English: 1. Validates connection and audio file 2. Uploads audio to OpenAI 3. Detects source language automatically 4. Transcribes and translates to English 5. Returns English text
usage: Connection Id from Connect node
Valid audio file in supported format
Audio must contain speech (not just music or silence)

upload-file.name: UploadFile
upload-file.summary: Upload a file to OpenAI file storage for use with assistants, fine-tuning, or batch operations.
upload-file.howItWorks: Uploads a file to your OpenAI account storage: 1. Validates connection is using your own API key (not Robomotion Credits) 2. Checks file exists and has supported extension 3. Uploads file to OpenAI 4. Returns file ID for use with other OpenAI features
usage: Connection with your own OpenAI API key (Robomotion Credits NOT supported)
File in supported format
File must exist and be accessible
Sufficient storage quota in your OpenAI account
